Key Arguments: Opposition to government or ACMA policing or influencing media for misinformation or disinformation.
Support for freedom of speech and expression without fear of fines.
Belief that restricting information leads to dictatorship and lack of freedom.
Skepticism about the ability of government officials to determine truth without bias.
Main Themes: Importance of unrestricted access to information
Notable Quotes: I want to hear what everyone has to say and then make my own mind up about what is the truth.
To take away freedom of speech leads to dictatorship where someone else tells you what to think, what you can say and what you can do.
Once you restrict information it is no longer true science.
